arts.ttl: Diego Simeone heaps praise on Julian Alvarez after Valladolid win
arts.sum: Julián Álvarez (26) overtakes Antoine Griezmann’s record (25) of most goals scored in the Diego Simeone era in their debut season. “There is no simple match, there are moments of difficulties, different things can happen, the penalty, the free-kick deflected off the wall, and football does not wait for you, it needs you to do your best today, today and today and today and we were able to work well.”

arts.ttl: Ajax and PSV continue to monitor Real Valladolid‘s Raúl Moro while Osasuna plot summer move
arts.sum: Real Valladolid winger Raúl Moro is still a target for both Ajax and PSV this summer according to Spanish outlet Relevo. However, the Dutch giants face fierce competition as Osasuna…

arts.ttl: Atletico Madrid vs Real Valladolid Prediction: Team News, Predicted Lineups and Where To Watch
arts.sum: Atletico Madrid, currently third in LaLiga, host bottom-of-the-table Real Valladolid on Monday, at 20:00 GMT. The hosts will be keen to capitalise on any dropped points by their title rivals, while th...

arts.ttl: Major update to Ángel Correa’s future while Atlético weigh up changes in defense
arts.sum: Still, Molina is Argentina’s starting right-back, and a €35 million fee for a 27-year-old World Cup-winning defender — in a market light on quality full-backs — seems a fair price for any club that wants him. Meanwhile, Nahuel Molina has a number of suitors per Matteo Moretto, and Atlético could let him leave too — with the club said to be following Strasbourg right-back Guéla Doué as a possible replacement.

arts.ttl: La Liga Title Race: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Atletico Madrid Next Five Games After Matchweek 31
arts.sum: Barcelona still lead the La Liga title race with Real Madrid and Atlético Madrid struggling to keep up.

arts.ttl: Diego Simeone evaluates Atlético’s title hopes after victory over Sevilla
arts.sum: Atlético Madrid coach Diego Simeone spoke to the media before Monday night’s fixture against Real Valladolid in La Liga, addressing specific players’ form and objectives for the season. When asked about the challenges ahead, he was also tested to reflect on a full week to rest and train in preparation for the league fixture, and Simeone responded that “it is a week that can be managed in different ways and depending on the moment”.
